text: The Eure () is a river between Normandy and Centre-Val de Loire in north- western France, left tributary of the Seine. It is long. It rises at Marchainville in the Orne department and joins the Seine near Pont-de-l'Arche. Two departments are named after the Eure, namely Eure and Eure-et-Loir. Places along the river: * Orne (61): Marchainville, La Lande-sur-Eure, Neuilly-sur- Eure. * Eure-et-Loir (28): Courville-sur-Eure, Saint-Georges-sur-Eure, Fontenay-sur-Eure, Chartres, Saint-Prest, Maintenon, Nogent-le-Roi, Mézières- en-Drouais, Cherisy, Anet. * Eure (27): Évreux, Ivry-la-Bataille, Garennes- sur-Eure, Bueil, Merey, Pacy-sur-Eure, Ménilles, Chambray, Croisy-sur-Eure, Autheuil-Authouillet, Acquigny, Louviers, Le Vaudreuil, Val de Reuil, Pont- de-l'Arche, Martot. Its main tributaries are the Avre and the Iton. ==References== Category:Rivers of Orne Category:Rivers of Eure-et-Loir Category:Rivers of Eure Category:Rivers of Normandy Category:Rivers of Centre- Val de Loire Category:Rivers of France Category:Chartres
title: Eure (river)
